cell.color: The restaurant offers guaranteed seating, a wait staff, and moderate food prices, which many families appreciate.

With the animal photo booth, your guests can purchase a cute photo memento of their visit to the zoo. Adult guests like to get their photos taken, but younger guests show no interest in such activities.
Zoo guests can use the ATM (Automated Teller Machine) to withdraw spending money, which may encourage them to buy more food and souvenirs and to make donations to your zoo.

The cheesecake cart offers a tasty, filling dessert that is particularly popular with adult male guests. Guests often look for dessert after eating other foods so it's a good idea to place the cheesecake cart near other food stands.
The coffee stand offers hot coffee that is enjoyed by adult guests and some younger guests, who often discover they don't like the taste.

A compost building in your zoo is the repository for all of the garbage, compost, and recyclable items collected by you and your zoo staff.
Since you can earn money for your recycling efforts, including a compost building in your zoo can be a smart economic move. Due to the aromatic nature of the compost building, it's best to place it in a remote corner of your zoo where it won't offend your guests.
The cotton candy cart offers a sweet, nutritionally empty snack that is sure to cause sticky fingers and faces. Cotton candy is a favorite treat for children.
Kids can climb onto the hippo's back and bounce up and down on the hippo bouncy ride - a great way to burn off energy before the long car trip home.

Family restrooms are larger and cost more than small restrooms, but they accommodate more guests. Guests who don't have to stand in line for the small bathroom can spend their time viewing animals and enjoying your zoo's more entertaining amenities.

The front gate is the main entrance to your zoo. Every guest who visits your zoo will pass through the front gate (and pay admission!). It is a good idea to leave plenty of open space around this main entry point to allow your guests to come and go easily.
Clicking on the front gate will open the Zoo Status panel where you can review information about your zoo's performance.
The fruit cup cart offers a nutritious snack option for your zoo guests, which makes adult women guests happy.

The gift cart offers gifts and souvenirs that are related to the not-so-endangered animals featured in the zoo. Guests like gift carts almost as much as the gift shop, but gift carts can't offer as much merchandise or accommodate as many guests. The souvenirs they stock, however, have the advantage of being easy to carry.

The gift shop, which offers gifts and souvenirs featuring the rarer animals in your zoo, can accommodate multiple guests at a time. Guests particularly enjoy purchasing a souvenir when they've had a great experience in your zoo, and their purchases can do a lot to help your zoo's bottom line.
A gift shop can be a good investment when your zoo features rarer animals like the African elephant, the mountain gorilla, and the giant panda.
The giraffe slide is a piece of playground equipment that can send one child at a time sliding down the slippery chute.
Serving fine cuisine, the fancy restaurant is popular with adult guests who appreciate table service. These guests don't mind paying the higher prices in exchange for the more refined atmosphere.

This stand offers the classic American fast food - hamburgers. The hamburger stand is a safe dining choice for families - kids love burgers, and parents like the low price. To keep the whole family happy, place a beverage stand and a couple of picnic tables nearby.
This stand sells hot dogs, which are enjoyed by your younger zoo guests. To keep the whole family happy, place a beverage stand and a couple of picnic tables nearby.

The ice cream cart features classic ice cream treats that are a big hit with the younger guests who visit your zoo. The sound of the bell on the ice cream cart can attract hot, hungry youngsters from all over your zoo.
The fun-filled family restaurant does a great job of providing a kid-friendly environment where multiple guests with a place to satisfy their food and beverage needs.
The gorilla climbing bar set offers kids (and limber adults) a true "jungle gym" experience, where they can climb and swing from the horizontal and vertical bars just like the great apes do.
Kids can climb onto the kangaroo's back and bounce up and down on the kangaroo bouncy ride, which is not such a good idea if you've just had lunch or a snack.
The popcorn cart provides guests of all ages with an economical and filling snack treat. Popcorn is especially popular with adult male guests, who like to shove it in their mouths by the handful.

The pretzel cart provides guests with an economical and filling snack treat. Pretzels are particularly popular with adult female guests, but they make them thirsty, so be sure to include a beverage stand nearby.
The small restroom has a limited capacity but is an essential amenity for the comfort of your guests. Zoo guests who cannot find a bathroom when they need one will become very unhappy.
Kids can climb onto a rhino's back and bounce up and down - a great photo opp!
The salad stand provides guests with a convenient, inexpensive, and healthful dining option. Salads are a particularly popular menu item with adult female zoo guests.

The shish kebab stand, which features roasted meat and vegetables on skewers, provides guests with a gourmet food option.
Gourmet foods like the shish kebab cost more than some of the other dining options, but some adult guests appreciate and are willing to pay the higher prices for fancier foods.
The soda stand provides guests with a convenient and inexpensive beverage option. Not surprisingly, sodas are especially popular with the kids.
The water drink stand, which features fancy bottled spring water, provides adult guests with a non-sugary beverage option.
The staff center is the building your zoo staff, including zookeepers, animal educators, and maintenance workers, will return to when they have no active assignments or pressing tasks.
The sub stand provides guests with a convenient and inexpensive dining option. Sub sandwiches are especially popular with adult male zoo guests.

The sushi stand, which features raw fish and rice, provides guests with a gourmet food option. Gourmet foods like sushi cost more than some of the other dining options, but adult female guests appreciate and are willing to pay for fancier foods.
Kids can climb onto the lion's back and bounce up and down on the lion bouncy ride, which is something you simply can't do with animals in their exhibits.
Animal educators require a podium to allow them to communicate interesting animal information to zoo guests.

The insect house is crammed full of small exhibits featuring a large range of arthropods, including spiders, bees, and centipedes. The exhibits also feature interesting information about all the bugs and the bees.
The insect house is very popular with younger zoo guests.

The reptile house features small exhibits with animals that crawl or move on their bellies (snakes!) or on short, small legs (lizards!). The exhibits also feature interesting information about the evolution of reptiles and their relationship to dinosaurs.
Younger zoo guests especially enjoy watching the scaly creatures who live in the reptile house.

The Shetland pony ride gives zoo guests an opportunity to climb on the back of a Shetland pony (a small, stocky horse) and go for a ride around the pony ride compound.
The Shetland pony ride costs extra, but your younger zoo guests will think it's worth every penny.
